meanings.definition: Strictness or severity in judgment or discipline.
meanings.sent1: The teacher applied rigour when grading the exams.
meanings.sent2: She approached her work with rigour, making sure every detail was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The rigour of the referee's decision left the players in shock.
meanings.sent4: The rigour of the law was felt by all who dared to break it.
meanings.sent5: The rigour of the winter storm made travel nearly impossible.

meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely thorough and careful.
meanings.sent1: His research was known for its rigour and attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with rigour, ensuring it met all safety standards.
meanings.sent3: The rigour with which she organized the event impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The rigour of his planning was evident in the flawless execution of the project.
meanings.sent5: The rigour of her investigation uncovered the truth behind the mystery.

meanings.definition: Harshness or severity in dealing with others.
meanings.sent1: The rigour of his punishment shocked the students into better behavior.
meanings.sent2: She faced the rigour of her boss's criticism with grace and determination.
meanings.sent3: The rigour of the judge's sentence left the courtroom in silence.
meanings.sent4: The rigour of her scolding made him realize the seriousness of his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The rigour of the coach's training regimen pushed the athletes to their limits.
